dcterms:creator: John S. Garofolo
Lori F. Lamel
William M. Fisher
Jonathan G. Fiscus
David S. Pallett
Nancy L. Dahlgren
Victor Zue
dcterms:description: The TIMIT dataset is an acoustic-phonetic continuous speech corpus designed for the development and evaluation of automatic speech recognition systems.
dcterms:title: TIMIT

dcterms:creator: Cees H. Taal
Jesper Jensen
Arne Leijon
dcterms:description: The Approximated Speech Intelligibility Index (ASII) is used to evaluate the intelligibility of speech in noisy environments.
dcterms:title: Approximated Speech Intelligibility Index (ASII)

dcterms:creator: Adel Zahedi
Michael S. Pedersen
Jan Østergaard
Thomas U. Christiansen
Lars Bramsløw
Jesper Jensen
dcterms:description: The Speech Intelligibility Index (SII) is a measure used to quantify the intelligibility of speech in various acoustic environments.
dcterms:title: Speech Intelligibility Index (SII)

dcterms:creator: J. Jensen
Cees H. Taal
dcterms:description: The Extended Short-Time Objective Intelligibility (ESTOI) is an algorithm designed to predict the intelligibility of speech masked by modulated noise.
dcterms:title: ESTOI (Extended Short-Time Objective Intelligibility)

dcterms:creator: ITU-T
dcterms:description: The Perceptual Evaluation of Speech Quality (PESQ) is a standard for assessing the quality of speech signals.
dcterms:title: PESQ (Perceptual Evaluation of Speech Quality)
